resources.string: DevFest_App
Developer Student Circle
VIT Vellore
About Us

Google Developer Group, VIT Vellore is a non-profit developers group to learn, share and know more about Google technologies. Our events are open to newbies, developers, managers and organizations who are interested in Google\'s technologies or use them as part of their projects.
Tech Talks
Google talks are a grassroots-style series of presentation given by various technical experts spanning a wide spectrum of topics in technology and related areas.
DEV Fests
GDG Dev Fests are large scale,community-run events that offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas , hack-a-thons , code labs and many more.
Code School
Google code school teaches web technologies in the comfort of your browser through video lessons , coding challenges and screencasts.
Beta Testing
Beta Testing is the essence of developing a software. We test every aspect of our product before releasing it for the real-world exposure.
The Hackathon
What is the format of the hack?

The hack is scheduled to be a month long. During this month participants will have to submit their ideas and work on them. Selected teams will get a chance to pitch their ideas to judges on the final day.
What is the prize money?
Total prizes worth 20 lakh to be won.
When is the event?
The event will be held on the 7th of October where the finalists will be allowed to pitch their ideas.
What is the venue for the event?
The venue for the event is Anna Auditorium.
What is the eligibility for participants?
Anyone can register for the hack, as the month progresses eliminations will be made based on the ideas submitted.
What is the timeline for the event?
Refer from the timeline section.
What is the evaluation criteria ?
R1 : Judged on the basis of Novelty and feasibility of ideas. R2 : Judged on the basis of implementation of the idea. R3 : Decided upon by the judges.
Are there any rules and regulations participants are supposed to follow ?
Participants are required to follow the guidelines mentioned on the gravitas website.
How much time will a team get to present on the final day?
Each team will get about 3\-5 mins of pitching time.
What do I need?
The participants are expected to carry their laptops and chargers to the event.
What is the min and max team size?
There is no minimum team size. Teams upto a number of 5 members will be allowed.
What are problem statements and by when will we get them?
Problem statements will be conveyed to the participants by Sept 10th.
What about food?
Pizzas and other refreshments like coffee will be provided to the participants.
What do I need for the final pitch?
Participants will be required to present a fully working project
Help
If you need any assistance you can write to us at dscvitvellore@gmail.com or approach any of our coordinators present during the event. All the best, and happy hacking!
DevTalks
What is DevTalks?

DevTalks is a convention which will have keynote sessions delivered by industry experts about various ‘Disruptive technologies used in the Industry’. It will also comprise of a networking session at the end for the finalists of the hackathon.
What is the venue for the event?
The venue for the event is Anna Auditorium.
When is the event?
The event will take place on the 6th of October.
What is the event timeline?
Refer from the previous section
What is the registration procedure?
After registering for the waitlist we will send you a registration form. Based on the content of the form you will be sent an invite confirming your participation in the convention.
What is the networking session?
The networking session would be a closed one on one session between the speakers/judges and the participants.
When will the networking session take place?
The networking session will take place immediately after the convention is over.
What is the eligibility for the session?
Hackathon finalists and active participants selected during the convention will be eligible for the networking session.
What’s the registration fee?
There is no registration fee for the event, DevTalks is completely free of cost.
How do I get to VIT Vellore?
VIT Vellore ,Near Katpadi Road, Vellore, Tamil Nadu 632014
Travel and Accommodation for the event?
Participants are required to find their own mode of transport. For information about accommodation you can refer to the gravitas website.
